doc.field: Schaeuble apologizes for donations scandal

Following daily new revelations, CDU Chairman Schaeuble apologized to the Bundestag for the donations scandal of his party. He regretted in particular "that it was in our responsibility that it was obviously contravened against the law, and that we have damaged trust in the integrity of democratic parties and institutions". SPD Chairman Struck calls the scandal the biggest political scandal in Germany's history. SPD and The Greens want to expand the task of the investigations committe to include a clarification of the CDU's complete illegal financial affairs. After today's first meeting of the committe, Chairman Volker Naumann (SPD) announced that his party, The Greens, and also the FDP will submit an appropriate proposal to the Bundestag in February. The members of the committee also agreed on a list of 26 witnesses who will be interrogated within the next months. Former Chancellor Helmut Kohl is amongst them. CDU is confident that Kohl, as announced before Christmas, will justify himself to the committee. However, nothing is sure.
CDU/CSU financial expert commits suicide

Wolfgang Huellen, employee of the CDU/CSU fraction committed suicide. He was leader of the "Budget and Finances" Department for several years. CDU/CSU fraction rejects initial assumptions that the suicide is connected to the donations scandal. Huellen left a suicide note, the content of which, however, is still kept secret by police and CDU/CSU fraction. This evening it became known that Wolfgang Huellen was under investigations because of alleged disloyalty. This was confirmed by the Berlin prosecuting attorney.
Preliminary proceedings against Schleusser discontinued

Duesseldort prosecuting attorneys discontinued preliminary proceedings against North-Rhine Westphalian Finance Minister Schleusser. Schleusser was accussed of offending official secrets; allegedly he had given away an upcoming investigation of suspected tax evasion of the Westdeutsche Landesbank to bank chairman Neuber. Yesterday, Schleuser was incriminated by Sabine Wichmann, the widow of the headpilot of a charter airline.
Pension negotiations: secure pension for 30 yrs

Coalition and opposition want to work on a pension scheme for the next 30 years. After the first round of negotiations in Berlin, experts from SPD, The Greens, CDU/CSU, and FDP agreed to the timeframe of 2030 which was demanded mainly by the opposition. Disputed questions of basic security and pension adjustements beginning in 2002 will be discussed later.
Daimler-Chrysler calls back all-purpose vehicles

Automobile producer Daimler-Chrysler calls back 652.000 Jeep Cherokees and Grand Cherokees in the United States. According to the company, road salt could damage the brakes of these cars. However, as yet no accidents or injuries have been reported.
Helmut Hofer permitted to leave Iran

German businessman Helmut Hofer, who has been captured in Iran, can finally leave the country. A court in Teheran fined Hofer today for alleged assault of a policeman to around DM 13.000. Hofer has spent two years in Iranian jails. In 1997, he was initially sentenced to death for having had an illegal sexual relationship to a muslim woman.
ICE-disaster due to overused steel tire
The Juni 1998 ICE-disaster in Eschede with a 101 death-toll was due to over-exertion of a steel tire. This became evident from a report released today by the Lueneburg prosecutors attorney.
Film of oil on river Rhine dissolved

The 13 km long and 100 m wide film of oil on the river Rhine which had formed yesterday between Karlsruhe and Leimersheim, dissolved on its own. According to the waterprotection police, no environmental damage was done.
Days for qualifications for soccer world championship

German National Soccer league will start its qualification for the world championship 2002 in Japan and South Corea with a home game against Greece on September, 2, and an away game against England on Oktober, 7. This was agreed today by the German Soccer Association who met with the opponents Greece, England, Albania, and Finland.
Basler injured

Shock for 1.FC Kaiserslautern: midfield player Mario Basler injured himself this morning in Kaiserslautern. He has a teared ligament, and will likely not be available to the national league soccer team for several weeks. Basler has done only 5 games for the "red devils" since his move to the Palatinate.
